content:
When a perf run is requested on a PR and the bot summary says that there have not been any significant performance changes, it still applies the rollup=never label.

Doesn't it actually make sense to not do that, since we already know that the pr does not have any perf impact? :thinking:
I think there's probably room to avoid it in some cases, but our "significant changes" metric currently excludes some changes, which could accumulate in a rollup and cause pain
our queue is also not really suffering for it imo, so I'm not too worried
